articles.author: By The Associated Press
articles.title: What's new in the China virus outbreak
articles.description: About 6,000 cases of a new viral respiratory illness have been confirmed since an outbreak began in the Chinese city of Wuhan.
articles.content:
About 6,000 cases of a new viral respiratory illness have been confirmed since an outbreak began in the Chinese city of Wuhan.
Scientists have identified the illness as a new kind of coronavirus. Coronaviruses are a large family of viruses, some of which cau… [+2236 chars]

articles.title: New Mexico State to halt student trips to China amid virus
articles.description: LAS CRUCES, N.M. (AP) — New Mexico State University says its study abroad office will not be sending students to China amid a new virus that has sickened thousands and killed more than 100.
articles.content:

articles.title: NJ sets up hotline to field calls on deadly viral outbreak
articles.description: NEWARK, N.J. (AP) — New Jersey Gov. Phil Murphy said Wednesday his administration has set up a 24-hour hotline to answer the public's questions about the deadly virus that has hit China.

articles.title: Fed leaves key rate alone but sees virus among global risks
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The Federal Reserve kept its key interest rate unchanged at a low level Wednesday amid an economy that looks solid but faces potential global threats, including from China’s viral outbreak.

articles.description: LONDON (AP) — The indoor world athletics championships in Nanjing, China, have been postponed by a year because of the dangerous virus outbreak in the country, the sport's governing body announced Wednesday.

articles.title: China's women's Olympic soccer team quarantined in Australia
articles.description: BRISBANE, Australia (AP) — China's national women's soccer team has been quarantined in Australia ahead of an Olympic qualifying tournament as fears spread about the outbreak of a new virus that has killed more than 130 people.
